required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Controlled Trial of a Documentary to Encourage Plant-based Eating

brief_summary.textblock: This study will assess whether watching a documentary video about the health, environmental, and ethical consequences of eating meat and animal products reduces participants' self-reported intake of these items.

primary_outcome.measure: Total meat and animal product consumption
primary_outcome.time_frame: Consumption over the 1-week time frame spanning approximately 1 week to 2 weeks after baseline data collection
primary_outcome.description: Self-reported meat and animal product consumption (ounces consumed over the past week)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Consumption over the 1-week time frame spanning approximately 1 week to 2 weeks after baseline data collection
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported meat consumption (ounces consumed over the past week)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Consumption over the 1-week time frame spanning approximately 1 week to 2 weeks after baseline data collection
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported animal product consumption (ounces consumed over the past week)

secondary_outcome.measure: Consumption of each of 8 individual categories of meats and animal products
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Consumption over the 1-week time frame spanning approximately 1 week to 2 weeks after baseline data collection
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported consumption (ounces consumed over the past week)

secondary_outcome.measure: Total consumption of selected, healthy plant-based foods (ounces consumed over the past week)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Consumption over the 1-week time frame spanning approximately 1 week to 2 weeks after baseline data collection
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported consumption (ounces consumed over the past week)

other_outcome.description: A single Likert item adapted from Heckler (2010), ranging from 1 to 6, with higher scores representing greater perceived importance. The exact text is provided in detailed preregistration: https://osf.io/xrckh/registrations.

A single Likert item adapted from Heckler (2010), ranging from 1 to 6, with higher scores representing greater perceived importance. The exact text is provided in detailed preregistration: https://osf.io/xrckh/registrations.

A single Likert item adapted from Heckler (2010), ranging from 1 to 6, with higher scores representing greater perceived importance. The exact text is provided in detailed preregistration: https://osf.io/xrckh/registrations.

Caviola et al.'s (2019) Speciesism Scale, consisting of 6 Likert items each ranging from 1 to 7. After reverse-coding, a higher score on the sum of the items (ranging from 6 to 42) represents greater speciesism. The exact text for all items is provided in detailed preregistration: https://osf.io/xrckh/registrations.

other_outcome.measure: Interest in animal welfare activism and reform
other_outcome.description: 2 items modified from Corning et al.'s (2002) Activism Orientation Scale as well as 3 novel items, consisting in total of 5 items each ranging from 1 to 7. A higher score on the sum of the items (ranging from 5 to 35) represents greater interest in activism and reform. The exact text for all items is provided in detailed preregistration: https://osf.io/xrckh/registrations.

Ho et al.'s (2015) 8-item Social Dominance Orientation [SDO(7)] scale, consisting in total of 5 items each ranging from 1 to 7. After reverse-coding, a higher score on the sum of the items (ranging from 8 to 56) represents greater interest in activism and reform. The exact text for all items is provided in detailed preregistration: https://osf.io/xrckh/registrations.

intervention.description: A 20-minute documentary about the health, environmental, and animal welfare consequences of eating meat and animal products
A 20-minute unrelated video (a motivational talk entitled "Listening to shame")

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participant is currently located in the United States
- Participant is at least 18 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participant is located outside the United States
- Participant is less than 18 years old

link.description: Future location of data, code, and materials

patient_data.ipd_description: All materials and analysis code required to reproduce all results will be made publicly available. All data except for participants' counties of residence (which is considered identifying information) will also be made publicly available.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Immediately upon journal acceptance or earlier if possible given embargo policies.
